intro: Cryptantha diplotricha var. humilis, commonly known as the low cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in arid or rocky environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
